{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3146138,"name":"Joel Singh","username":"Joel_Singh","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joel_singh/{size}/178820_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-15T19:28:14.393Z","cooked":"

Howdy! I am trying to figure out the feedforward constants for a lift mechanism using Sys ID. However, when I have my encoder selection selected as “Encoder Port” I’m unable to connect to the robot through network tables.

I’m able to deploy successfully and communications on driver station is green, however, robot code is red. I am on the latest version of WPILIB.

The odd thing is that everything works perfectly when I have data port selected. I’m able to connect through network tables and run the tests but the encoders report zero because they’re plugged into the encoder port, not the data port.

Anybody have any suggestions of what I can try?


Driver Station1920×206 13.5 KB

Logger442×508 30.8 KB

@bovlb

SysId, encoder reported traveling 0 radians Control System
Can you see the robot with DriverStation? Can you post a screenshot open to the diagnostics tab?

What do you mean by diagnostics tab? I don’t see anything like that under widgets or any other tab.

OK. This tells us that the roboRIO has no “Robot Code”, which would explain the lack of NetworkTables. Did you encounter any problems when you pressed the Deploy button?

Hmm. I’m not sure what to advise next.

You could try re-imaging the roboRIO with the latest version.

Just as an experiment, you could try using an Ethernet or USB tether to see if it changes things. That’s obviously not convenient for a full sysid test run.

Sounds like you’re probably hitting this: SysId robot program exits with "Hall sensor measurement period must be in the range of [8, 64]" · Issue #479 · wpilibsuite/sysid · GitHub

Until WPILib does a new release you could grab the development build with the fix from here and try running that: Fix display of Spark Max time measurement window setting · wpilibsuite/sysid@27502bd · GitHub

I downloaded the development build and it works. THANK YOU SO SOOSOSOSOS MUCH. IT WORKS. I have spent an absurd amount of time trying to get Sys ID to work. THANK YOU.

Note to anybody else trying this solution: You’ll have to be logged into github to actually download the artifact (development build).
